result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Wilson

defendant.name: Wilson, Travis J.

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM cases 21CM740, 22CF715, 22CT109, 22CM371, 21CT242 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis J. Wilson in court, in custody with Attorney George E. Miller. Attorney Miller moves to dismiss 22CF715 as the Information was not filed timely after the waiver of preliminary hearing. State does not have argument. Court grants motion to dismiss.
Hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Consent and Motion for Substitution of Attorney

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:41 AM Cases 21CM740, 21CT242, 22CF715, 22CM371 & 22CT109 Defendant Travis J. Wilson in court, in custody. Attorney Fran Rivard appeared via video conference. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to a Preliminary hearing in 22CF715 and court accepts waiver. 
Not guilty pleas entered in all counts in all files

All cases referred to Br. 1 for scheduling.

9:38 AM cases 21CM740, 22CM371, 22CF715, 22CT109 and 21CT242 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis J. Wilson in court, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Travis J. Wilson. Attorney Rivard states he has been unable to meet with Defendant and requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/27/22 at 2pm
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.

(11:02 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis J. Wilson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Travis J. Wilson.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
